quest.name: Deep Designs
journal: Y'shtola would have you depart for the Tempest without delay.
objectives: Speak with Tolshs Aath in the Ondo Cups.
Retrieve the mnyiri livers from the Flounders' Floor.
Deliver the mnyiri livers to Tolshs Aath.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Would that I had found the words to deny Elidibus. We are so much more than he believes us to be, and yet...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...Am I the only one who sees the irony in “Ardbert” calling us puppets?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Disdain and obfuscation. What is thy true design, Emissary...?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I hate to leave him like that. Gods, they can't even let a man rest in peace...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Thancred told me what Lahabrea did to him. I can't imagine how he's feeling right now.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Alphinaud has the right of it. Let us pay visit to the Ondo.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We should speak with Tolshs Aath first. As chieftain, he is doubtless privy to a great many secrets.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Don't be shy, now.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Perhaps we might look in on Paushs Ooan while we're in the area.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: This place feels much less ominous than the first time we were here. Then again, we did have the shadow of your impending death hanging over us.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Mayhap we shall find the secrets we seek in these depths...should their keepers consent to aid us.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The last time we were here, the Ondo sent us to slay a massive creature. 'Twas as large as Leviathan, twice as angry, and... Yes, of course I jest. It was only half as large.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I'm glad to have the opportunity to visit the Tempest again. It's so lovely here─like a different world entirely.

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: I have sent for no finless ones. Perhaps you instead come seeking something of usss?

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: Ruins which your kind have yet to explore... I sssee.

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: I know of one such place. Alas, under these circumstances, I am afraid we can spare none to guide you there.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: And what circumstances are these?

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: Rather than hunt for their own meals, the benthos have pillaged our stores of mnyiri liver. They must be replenished with haste.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The benthos... A particularly violent tribe of Ondo, if I recall?

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: A band of bottom-feeders. We all lost much in the Flood, but while others work to rebuild, they resort to thievery and murder.

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: Revenge, they call it, when they prey upon your kind─but do not be fooled. They care not who they harm. Would that we had the warriors to challenge them.

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: This is not the first time they have ssstolen from us, but there is no resource more precious than liver. All must dedicate themselves to the hunt.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Unless, of course, we were to reclaim the livers for you.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It seems a fitting payment for vital information, does it not?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Moreover, one could argue that by employing Bismarck to reach these depths, thereby driving back the waters, we are in part responsible for the deeds of those driven to desperate ends by the changing climes.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: “One good turn” and all that.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: We certainly can't leave them like this.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Could we not simply hunt mnyiri ourselves?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I thought you might say that. You've never been one to miss an opportunity to help.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We might...but that wouldn't discourage the benthos from stealing from the Ondo again, now would it?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Reclaiming the stores it is, then.

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: We would be grateful beyond words if you did.

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: The benthos have surely taken the livers back to the Flounders' Floor. But be warned─there will be no shortage of guards waiting to ssspear intruders.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Then we will have care not to draw their attention. Shall we?

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: The Flounders' Floor is to the northwest. We Ondo keep our distance. Were we not in dire straits, I would advise you to do the same...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: N-Nervous? Me? Not at all! It's a bit dark, though, isn't it...? Definitely not haunted, though. Certainly not...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: They're not much of a threat one-on-one, but Tolshs Aath was right about their numbers. If we fight them all, we'll be here a fortnight.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If I were a bandit leader, I'd surely keep my spoils deep within my stronghold...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: These aren't the livers, but they're certainly stolen from somewhere...unless wheat has started growing on the sea floor since last I checked.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Ryne scaled the wall with remarkable swiftness. Thancred taught her well.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I haven't forgotten why we're here, I swear! Only...this bird hasn't taken its eyes off me since I found it. I think it might be lonely.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The shoebill is staring at Ryne. Just. Staring.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: On cursory sniff, you detect the faint aroma of fresh oranges, a far cry from the rather memorable scent of mnyiri liver.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Thrusting your hand into each sack in turn, you find that all are filled with wheat down to the bottom. You also find that raw wheat is unpleasantly pointy.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: These boxes are filled with assorted vegetables. Liver is not a vegetable.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: From the squelching noise they make when prodded and the vile stench, you conclude that these bags are bursting with livers. Brilliant.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Are those them?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Perhaps you've deduced this already, but it seems the benthos have been raiding Kholusian storehouses as well as those of the Ondo.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Oranges, pumpkins, wheat...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: But we can discuss this after we see the livers safely back to Tolshs Aath. It wouldn't do to keep him in suspense.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So the benthos have been stealing supplies from the Kholusians. Hmm...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'm glad you had better luck than I did. I spent the whole time fighting one benthos after another.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I have a feeling that there is more to this...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Did you happen to see a bird while you were in the caves? Ryne insists that there was one...but how?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: To venture ashore and steal from the Kholusians entaileth unconscionable risk. Yet there is no denying the truth of our eyes.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I know it sounds strange, but there really was a bird in those caves.

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: I am relieved to see you unspeared.

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: Our precious livers! I knew you would not fail!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We also found all manner of foodstuffs from Kholusia in the Flounders' Floor. Tell me, Tolshs Aath, does that seem odd to you?

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: It is brazen, to be sure...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I'm reminded of rumors I've heard recently concerning a rash of thefts from Kholusian warehouses. The perpetrators enter in the dead of night and are gone before anyone has realized what has happened.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Eulmoran Army has been investigating, but thus far to no avail.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Perhaps the reason they have struggled so is that their quarry is of the sea...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The true question, then, is what we mean to do about it. Much as I would like to proceed to the ruins without further delay, we cannot allow the benthos to carry on as they are.

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: If I may─I believe that the ruins are, in fact, key to the benthos' plans.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Is that so?

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: These ruins, which lie deep within the illuminated land, are a recent discovery.

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: We have seen signs that the benthos are preparing to claim them with all haste. We could not fathom why, but in light of the knowledge that they have been stockpiling resources...

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: It is clear that their queen will sssoon give birth.

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: They require space to raise their young, and food for both queen and hatchlings to thrive.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Well, we can hardly fault them for that.

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: Under normal circumstances, perhapsss. But conditions in the Tempest are far from suitable for spawning, its resources barely able to sustain our current population. There is only one reason they would disregard this.

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: They seek to build an army, and with it take revenge upon the finless.

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: It is not a surprise. They came to us not long ago, seeking allies for the cause. We rebuffed them, of course─the suffering of others will not serve as balm to their own. Their queen, however, desires only bloodshed, and will gladly send her children to die in our stead.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If they are planning to wage war, that changes matters considerably.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Indeed.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I doubt that this can be resolved without violence, but perhaps with a show of force we can convince them to see reason before the die is cast.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I would rather not risk your people in the attempt. If we travel to the illuminated land, is there a way we might identify the ruins ourselves?

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: Yes. Once you reach its depths, go deeper still. You will see a monstrous structure there upon the sea floor.

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: That you have come to us now is the will of the ancient ones. They have guided you here that you may drive out the usurpers─those who seek to use their magnificent creations with vile purpose.

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: I have no doubt that they will show you the way forward.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I'm afraid that the dead do not speak quite so clearly. Nevertheless, we shall try not to disappoint.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: If what we seek lieth deeper still, beyond Amaurot, I would call upon the assistance of another...
